column4: hi guys, i use WICD to connect to my wi-fi router, i tried to set a WEP key to my connection in my router settings webpage (192.168.1.1) and then i set up the same WEP key on my WICD settings, but it wont work... fortunately from another pc i could re-enter the router settings webpage and delete that key. is there any known issue with WICD and WEP keys? shall i try a WAP? am I doin anything wrong? thanks
i dunno .. i havent been able to connect with wi fi.. with linux so far too
ive been using ethernet ... that worked
did anyone ever gamed with a sis graphics board ? 3d ?

that was a known issue of Network Manager, just uninstall it completely and install WICD instead, the wifi connection is perfect with it, fast and never falls, as it used to happen with NM. the only thing is, it seems having issues with WEP keys, but u do get connected!
ty .. i needed that.. thats nice of you , giving me that info
im goint to search for it with "add remove software"
maybe ill search it trougth with apt .. to maybe
i'll pass u the link of a guide that i followed, the all procedure its explained, i just gotta find it
ill bookmark it to read it later
im lookin for it among my bookmarks... it'll take a bit :D

im sorry but i cant find it, but i can tell u what to do, u gotta get rid of Network Manager and its wifi drivers which are some SERIALMONKEY drivers, could be the rtx or the rt73 u gotta do a little search for this one. once u've done with this, u install WICD and the new drivers, u better use the COMPAT-WIRELESS. try to google it, some guide will come up for sure, cuz apparently the wifi linux drivers wont work with some peripheal, such
as my wi-fi usb pen (my airport) and i guess if u had the same prob, urs is probably in that list. hope i helped :D
no prob.. network manager has been teasing me alot specialy with the wi fi part .. im glad to knowi ts a known issue
